name: places/ChIJl4z0ZyL2wokRhpZ5rNVeqRQ
formattedAddress: 36 W 106th St, New York, NY 10025, USA
adrFormatAddress: 36 W 106th St, New York, NY 10025, USA

editorialSummary.text: Modern, air-conditioned hostel offering a coffee bar, outdoor terraces & a lounge with pool tables.

originalText.text:
Would not recommend. This place is just a spot to rest for the night.

Probably the worst hostel I’ve been to. If you have a top bunk there is no outlet for you. There was not a functioning sink on the floor. Only one shower for 30+ ppl. Facilities were not clean. Bring your own lock for the lockers.

On the plus side, they do have bagels in the morning and location is great.

text.text:

On the plus side, they do have bagels in the morning and location is great.

originalText.text: It’s very dingy and dirty. I ran into a lot of roaches. They do not offer free drinkable water. You either have to pay for each bottle of water out of the vending machine, or try your luck with the brown tap water. I stayed here a few years ago and it still haunts me.

text.text: It’s very dingy and dirty. I ran into a lot of roaches. They do not offer free drinkable water. You either have to pay for each bottle of water out of the vending machine, or try your luck with the brown tap water. I stayed here a few years ago and it still haunts me.

originalText.text: I stayed only one night and it was really correct contrary to the very negative reviews and I was well received by the people at the reception. My room was in fair condition and the bathroom too. The location is currently undergoing work on the kitchen /living area but that’s not a big deal. The localisation is perfect with the metro nearby. The only thing I would recommend is that some improvement work should be done in the toilet / add some curtains in the bedroom etc

originalText.text:
Great location for walking around manhattan. It’s just across from Central Park with a pretty decent bodega down the street. I came here as a lone traveler. It’s a bed and a small locker. What else could you need. They clean the rooms at like 8 am every morning so you better be up. Staff was friendly and the place was clean.

I recommend a stop at the Dublin house pub if you come here. It’s a brisk walk but it’s worth it.

originalText.text:
Don’t support this business!

Some of the staff they employ here are from outside nyc (usually South America) and they literally overwork them without pay or food. They are working 30-40 hours without pay and since they can’t afford nyc, they are stuck there until they can return to their country. These volunteers are from a trade working website but are being exploited as “volunteers.” Staff live together in bunk beds with four in one tiny room and overall
the hostel is not clean.

Spend your money elsewhere and don’t support labor rights violations.
